title: Assignment05
section: Exploratory Data Analysis: Distribution and Ranking
text:
Exploratory Data Analysis: Distribution and Ranking

1️⃣ GDP per capita — Distribution


Mean: $20,346 | Median: $7,588 | 10th–90th pct: $1,000 – $53,383










Figure 1: Distribution of GDP per capita across countries (2022).





Interpretation.
As shown in Figure Figure 1, the distribution of GDP per capita in 2022 is highly right-skewed, with a mean of $20,346 and a median of $7,588. This large gap indicates that a few very high-income countries pull up the global average. Most countries lie between $1,000 and $53,000 (10th–90th percentile), showing that the majority of economies fall in low- to middle-income ranges.



2️⃣ Life expectancy — Distribution


Mean: 72.4 years | Median: 73.5 years | 10th–90th pct: 61.4 – 82.2 years










Figure 2: Distribution of life expectancy across countries (2022).





Interpretation.
Figure Figure 2 shows that life expectancy is centered around the mid-70s. In contrast with GDP per capita (Figure Figure 1), its distribution is much more symmetric, suggesting smaller inequality across countries in health outcomes.



3️⃣ Inflation rate — Ranking


Global average (sample): 12.49% | Average among the same 15: 12.48% | Count above global avg: 5/15










Figure 3: Inflation rate (annual %, 2022) among 15 most populous countries.





Interpretation.
Figure Figure 2 shows that life expectancy is centered around the mid-70s. In contrast with GDP per capita (Figure Figure 1), its distribution is much more symmetric, suggesting smaller inequality across countries in health outcomes.



4️⃣ Summary statistics table




Table 1: Summary statistics for three analyzed indicators (2022).

Data: World Development Indicators (Bank, 2024).
Document built with Quarto (Posit, PBC, 2025).

title: Assignment05
text:
Overview

Dataset: World Development Indicators (2022)
Focus: distribution (GDP per capita, life expectancy) and ranking (inflation)
Methods: Python (pandas, matplotlib) rendered with Quarto (Posit, PBC, 2025)
Source attribution: WDI (Bank, 2024)

title: Assignment05
text:
GDP per Capita — Distribution





Distribution of GDP per capita across countries (2022).




Notes: Right-skewed distribution with a long upper tail.

title: Assignment05
text:
Life Expectancy — Distribution





Distribution of life expectancy across countries (2022).




Notes: Most countries cluster around the low-to-mid 70s.

title: Assignment05
text:
Inflation — Ranking (Top 15 by Population)





Inflation rate (annual %, 2022) — 15 most populous countries.




Notes. Wide spread across major economies.

title: Assignment05
text:
Key Takeaways

GDP per capita: highly right-skewed distribution (few very high-income countries).
Life expectancy: tighter spread around ~70–75 years.
Inflation: substantial variation among the most populous economies.

title: Assignment05
text:

Data: World Bank WDI (Bank, 2024)
